title: MD
biography: Dr. Alok Sharma is a prominent neurosurgeon and neuroscientist recognized for his pioneering work in regenerative medicine and stem cell therapy for neurological disorders. He is the Director of the NeuroGen Brain & Spine Institute in Mumbai. Dr. Sharma has treated thousands of patients with incurable conditions like Autism, Cerebral Palsy, and Spinal Cord Injury using autologous bone marrow-derived stem cells. He is the Founding President of the Stem Cell Society of India.
aiSummary: Alok Sharma is a neurosurgery specialist with an H-index of 110 at NeuroGen Brain & Spine Institute (Director). Known for pioneered Motor Cortex Stimulation for intractable pain, Autologous bone marrow-derived stem cell therapy for Autism and performed 9,500+ verified procedures. Has been published in Nature Methods, IEEE Transactions on NanoBioscience, Life Science Alliance and recipient of the undefined (undefined). Based in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India.
techniquesInvented: Motor Cortex Stimulation for intractable pain
Autologous bone marrow-derived stem cell therapy for Autism
education: MS in General Surgery, Mumbai University
Fellowship in Neural Transplantation, Karolinska Hospital, Sweden
